abstract: Some chief executives say any company, no matter how small, can benefit from having a financial chief to help organize its finances and track its performance; typically, however, hiring one does not become essential until firms reach tipping point of $10 million to $20 million in revenue.
snippet: A reliable financial officer can free a chief executive to focus on other parts of the firm once a company’s revenue reaches a certain point, some C.E.O.’s say.
lead_paragraph: A reliable financial officer can free a chief executive to focus on other parts of the firm once a company’s revenue reaches a certain point, some C.E.O.’s say.

headline.main: When Should a Small Business Hire a Finance Chief?
